text: Ronildo Pereira de Freitas (born 23 October 1977 in Montes Claros, Minas Gerais), known as Tininho, is a Brazilian retired footballer. On the left side of the pitch, he operated as either a midfielder or a defender. ==Football career== In May 1998, at the age of 20, Tininho left Brazil and Associação Portuguesa de Desportos to sign with Feyenoord in the Netherlands.Feyenoord contracteert Tininho (Feyenoord signs Tininho); Voetbal International, 14 May 1998 In his first season with the Rotterdam team, he appeared in 28 games to help them win the Eredivisie after a six-year wait. After a brief spell back in his country with América Futebol Clube (MG), Tininho returned to the Netherlands, where he would remain for the following five seasons always in the top flight, with RBC Roosendaal, NEC Nijmegen and ADO Den Haag. In 2007, he joined AEK Larnaca F.C. from Cyprus, playing two seasons with the club and retiring subsequently. ==Honours== ;Feyenoord *Eredivisie: 1998–99 *Johan Cruijff Shield: 1999 ==References== ==External links== * *Beijen profile *Stats at Voetbal International Category:1977 births Category:Living people Category:Brazilian footballers Category:Association football defenders Category:Association football midfielders Category:Associação Portuguesa de Desportos players Category:América Futebol Clube (MG) players Category:Eredivisie players Category:Feyenoord players Category:RBC Roosendaal players Category:NEC Nijmegen players Category:ADO Den Haag players Category:Cypriot First Division players Category:AEK Larnaca FC players Category:Brazilian expatriate footballers Category:Expatriate footballers in the Netherlands Category:Expatriate footballers in Cyprus Category:Brazilian expatriate sportspeople in the Netherlands Category:Brazilian expatriate sportspeople in Cyprus
title: Tininho
